name: King and Queen of The Road - a pair of prints by Jeremy Slagle
description:
We were deeply honoured to  featured these beauties by designer Jeremy Slagle on the cover of Boneshaker issue #13.

You can hang them whichever way makes you happy. There is no top or bottom. These four-color silkscreen prints were originally designed for the Pinchflat Poster Blow out in Columbus, Ohio. But we thought they were so good - bright but distinguished, calming but alive - and pleasingly autumnal, that we had to share them with the world.

The prints are sold as a pair, they're 12" x 19" (30 x 48cm) each and printed on 100# Archival Concrete Gray French paper. Sold unframed in a sturdy cardboard postal tube.

name: Orange Leaves print by A-K Pirata
description:
A fabulous autumnal design by a-k pirata, digitally printed onto thick, textured, 250gsm A3 size Tinterette Gesso paper stock by Rik at Ripe Digital. Each print has been hand embossed with the Boneshaker embosser.

Prints sold unframed, but being A3 size (420 x 297 mm) they fit conveniently into standard shop-bought frames.

Sold unframed, shipped in a cardboard postal tube. With a free sticker! Yeah!

name: Vintage Bicycles 3-in-1 print by Jeremy Slagle
description:
One poster becomes three art prints. Post-a-prints are silk-screen printed on the highest-quality, acid-free archival stock—which means your art won’t fade or yellow. Illustrations by Jeremy Slagle, based on vintage, American made Schwinn Bicycles.

Two 8"x 10" prints and one 10"x 18" art print, sold as one sheet, shipped in a sturdy postal tube.

name: Polar Bear print by A-K Pirata
description:
Part of an ongoing collaboration with Bristol-based illustrator A-K Pirata, this wintry design has been digitally printed onto A3 size textured 250gsm Tinteretto Gesso paper by Rik at Ripe Digital. Each print has been hand embossed with the Boneshaker embosser.

Prints sold unframed, but being A3 size (420 x 297 mm) they fit conveniently into standard shop-bought frames.

Shipped in a sturdy postal tube.

name: Go Biking print by re-robot
description:
Our fine friends in the re-robot studio have produced this ace design, which we've had digitally printed onto thick, textured 250gsm Tinteretto Gesso paper. Each print has been hand-embossed with the Boneshaker embosser.

Prints are A3 size (420 x 297 mm). Sold unframed, and shipped in a cardboard postal tube. Being A3 size, they fit conveniently into many shop-bought frames.

Check out more of re-robot's work at www.re-robot.com

name: 'Velo' print by John Coe
description:
This design was originally produced as a limited edition screenprint for Artcrank, but those puppies sold out in no time, so we're offering these high quality digital reprints to allow a few more people to enjoy the image in their own homes. Printed by Rik at Ripe Digital on A3 size 250gsm Tinteretto Gesso paper, hand embossed with the Boneshaker embosser. 

Prints sold unframed, shipped in a strong cardboard postal tube. With a free sticker. Nice.

name: 'Drop Bars Not Bombs' print by Adams Carvalho
description:
Another fine-looking digital print by Boneshaker's long-time collaborator, Adams Carvalho, this one bearing the words 'Drop bars, not bombs' along the bottom. A3 size, on nice 250gsm textured Tinteretto Gesso paper stock, lovingly printed by Rik at Ripe Digital and hand-embossed with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

Prints sold unframed, but being A3 size (420 x 297 mm) they fit conveniently into standard shop-bought frames.

Check out more of Adams' work at ffffixas.tumblr.com

name: Major Taylor print by Eliza Southwood (yellow)
description:
Bike art at its best! To celebrate her beautiful feature in issue 10, we've teamed up with illustrator Eliza Southwood to create these rather appealing bicycle prints. The racer pictured is the pioneering Marshall 'Major' Taylor, who overcame extreme racial discrimination to win several world records and titles (including World Track Cycling Champion, 1899).

Digitally printed in Bristol by the ever-amenable Rik at Ripe Digital on A3 size, slightly textured tinteretto gesso paper. Each print has been hand-embossed by moonlight with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

Sold unframed (but being A3 it will fit easily into an appropriate shop-bought frame). 

http://www.elizasouthwood.com/

name: 'Fixie Bear' print by Adams Carvalho
description:
As featured on the cover of Boneshaker issue 5, it's Adams Carvalho's much-loved 'Fixie Bear' design, digitally printed in Bristol by the ever-amenable Rik at Ripe Digital on A3 size, heavy stock (250gsm) slightly textured Tinteretto Gesso paper. Each print has been hand-embossed by moonlight with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

A3 size, sold unframed.

Check out more of Adams' fine work at:

http://ffffixas.tumblr.com/

name: 'Minstrels' print by Ilse Weisfelt
description:
As featured in Boneshaker issue 12, this likeable design by illustrator Ilse Weisfelt has been lovingly printed by Rik at Ripe Digital onto 250gsm textured Tintertto Gesso paper, and each print has been hand embossed with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture - though please ignore the fact that the colouring looks a bit odd in this image, as it's a phone picture!).

Sold unframed, but being A3, these prints conveniently fit into shop-bought frames. 
Shipped in a cardboard postal tube, with a free sticker! Nice.

name: Trackstand Girl print by Adams Carvalho
description:
Another fine looking design from our friend Adams Carvalho, who we first began working with when he designed the cover for Boneshaker issue #5. This design is digitally printed on thick, textured 250gsm Tinteretto Gesso paper by Rik at Ripe Digital, and then hand embossed with the Boneshaker embosser (see second and third pics).

Sold unframed, but as the print is A3 size, it fits conveniently into shop-bought frames. 

Shipped rolled in a cardboard postal tube. With a free sticker! Yeah!

name: 'Wolfman' premium tee-shirt
description:
And you thought Wiggo had big facial hair...

...here's Wolfman, the fabulous furry freak brother from the cover of issue 8, as designed by Boneshaker's main man Stevie Gee. Printed in Bristol on high-quality Earth Positive cotton, with a triple-colour screenprint on the front and a super blingin' woven gold Boneshaker logo label on the nape. 

http://steviegee.tumblr.com/

http://unooneprint.com

name: 'Fixie Bear' t-shirt by Adams Carvalho (pale blue-grey)
description: Artwork as featured on the cover of Boneshaker Magazine issue 5, designed by the brilliant Adams Carvalho, hand printed onto a pale blue-grey, organic cotton, Earth Positive* tee by the good folks at White Duck screenprint. Discrete Boneshaker logo on the nape (see fourth pic). This is very similar to the the original 'fixie bear' t-shirt we produced, but the grey is slightly bluer. More of a pale blue-grey than a pale grey. The 2nd, 3rd and 4th pics hopefully illustrate this. *Earth Positive means the shirts are produced under the Global Organic Textile standard from Indian Cotton, certified by the Soil Association, and manufactured using solely renewable green energy from wind and solar power. Which is nice. -----------------------------------------------------   www.boneshakermag.com www.ffffixas.tumblr.com www.whiteduckscreenprint.co.uk

name: Boneshaker cycling cap
description:
Yes! Finally! A fresh batch of caps, lovingly made in Italy. We teamed up with our friends at the cycle cafe Look Mum No Hands! to get these beauties made. Boneshaker text logo printed on the peak (above and below), Crossed Cranks design printed on each side.

One size fits most - they're stretchy at the back and the peak pops up or down.

Better pictures coming soon...

name: Boneshaker x Howies t-shirt: This One Runs on Fat (blue)
description:
Representing the beginning of what we hope will be an ongoing collaboration with our longtime friends at Howies, this is a high-quality organic t-shirt emblazoned with the slogan 'This One Runs on Fat and Saves You Money, This One Runs on Money and Makes You Fat'. 

Nice.

name: Dynamoworks 'Age and Treachery Will Overcome Youth and Skill' print
description:
Produced by our friend Chris at Dynamoworks, this is an A2-size (594mmx420mm) signed and editioned screenprint poster with a famous quote from cycling legend Fausto Coppi. Printed on 200gsm off white Stockwell cartridge paper. Editioned to 50, signed and numbered by the artist. 

Sold unframed, shipped in a sturdy postal tube. 

FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING

Check out more of Dynamoworks wonderful output here:
www.dynamoworks.co.uk

name: 'Fixie Bear' by Adams Carvalho
description: Artwork as featured on the cover of Boneshaker Magazine issue 5, designed by the brilliant Adams Carvalho, hand printed onto a pale grey, organic cotton, Earth Positive* tee by the good folks at White Duck screenprint. Discrete Boneshaker logo on the nape (see third pic). *Earth Positive means the shirts are produced under the Global Organic Textile standard from Indian Cotton, certified by the Soil Association, and manufactured using solely renewable green energy from wind and solar power. Which is nice. MORE STOCK COMING SOON IN A MORE BLUE-ISH GREY -----------------------------------------------------   www.boneshakermag.com www.ffffixas.tumblr.com www.whiteduckscreenprint.co.uk

name: Boneshaker Magazine - Issue 12 (PDF Download)
description:
From its butterfly-fluttering cover to its freewheeling final page, Boneshaker #12 explores forgotten railroads, tours with travelling minstrels and jumps into freezing lakes. From rickshaw politics to open-source cargo bikes, from racing with missing limbs to riding in search of the simple life - there's poetry, strangeness and inspiration in equal measure. As ever, we've woven in the work of some wonderful illustrators, photographers and writers from around the world to bring all these bicycle stories to life. It's taken a while, but we're happy as a tailwind with how it's turned out. We hope you like it too.

By purchasing this digital format of the magazine, you are helping us to sustain the printed version, rather than replacing it. The artwork within the magazine is the copyright of the artists involved - with this PDF version you can click through to their websites and find out more about these great creative people.

PLEASE NOTE: Once you have purchased this from us, you will be sent a link from Pulley to the PDF file. This file is approx. 9mb, so please be patient while downloading. The download is limited to three attempts, if you have problems downloading, please contact us via www.boneshakermag.com

name: Our Chains Set Us Free t-shirt
description:
We're in cahoots once again with Bristol Cycle Festival, including producing this rather fine t-shirt, much like last year's but updated in a new colourway. Quality grey t-shirt emblazoned in blue with the slogan 'Our Chains Set us Free'.

Buying this t-shirt helps to make Bristol Cycle Festival happen - bringing hundreds of brilliant bicycle-related events to Boneshaker's home city every summer. 

To find out more, visit bristolcyclefestival.com

name: Boneshaker issue 11
description:
Over its 64 perfect-bound and advert-free pages, issue #11 includes bicycle walls of death, hump-backed scorchers from the 19th Century, bikes and bad politics, a photo essay on an unseen side of Keirin racing, tall-bikes as a tool for challenging conformity and a song-singing cycle ride to India, amongst other things…

Limited stock available of these - we're down to the last few...

name: Boneshaker x (iL) Soigneur Musette Bag
description: We've commissioned our good friends at (iL) Soigneur to create this limited run of Boneshaker musettes. They're ideal for city riding, just right for lock, wallet, phone and lights. Maybe a hip flask too. The bags measure 32cm across and 25cm high. Taking inspiration from the original road racing musette, an (iL) Soigneur is a bag with a difference, handmade in Bristol from strong black material with a contrast white lining (makes it easier to find things) and a reflective Boneshaker logo on the front and reflective (iL) Soigneur logo on the reverse for extra safety. Photos of Jude Brosnan by Maria Brosnan. Read Jude's ace bloggings at http://ispeakbike.blogspot.co.uk/ --------------------------------------

name: 'Yeren' print by Ivy Tai
description:
"The Yeren is a cryptid. He is hidden in the mountainous forests of western China. This mysterious bipedal creature is peaceful and usually avoids encounters with people," says illustrator Ivy Tai. And here he is, with his big jolly head bursting out of a bicycle-rickshaw. What fun.

A3 size print, digitally printed by Rik at Ripe Digital on textured, 250gsm Tinteretto Gesso paper. There is a white border around the image. Sold unframed, shipped in a postal tube.

www.ivytai.com

name: Boneshaker x Howies t-shirt: This One Runs on Fat (white)
description:
Representing the beginning of what we hope will be an ongoing collaboration with our longtime friends at Howies, this is a high-quality organic t-shirt emblazoned with the slogan 'This One Runs on Fat and Saves You Money, This One Runs on Money and Makes You Fat'. 

We've only a handful of this colourway - and only in size XL, which are far too big for our model, Paul. WHich is why we're offering 'em up to you lucky chumps!

name: Boneshaker x Howies t-shirt: This One Runs on Fat (grey)
description:
Representing the beginning of what we hope will be an ongoing collaboration with our longtime friends at Howies, this is a high-quality organic t-shirt emblazoned with the slogan 'This One Runs on Fat and Saves You Money, This One Runs on Money and Makes You Fat'. 

Nice.

name: 'Fixie Lean' print by Adams Carvalho
description:
Another fine-looking digital print by Boneshaker's long-time collaborator, Adams Carvalho. A3 size, on nice 250gsm textured Tinteretto Gesso paper stock, lovingly printed by Rik at Ripe Digital and hand-embossed with the Boneshaker embosser. 

Sold unframed, but the print is a standard A3 size so fits easily into off-the-shelf shop bought frames.

Check out more of Adams' work at ffffixas.tumblr.com

name: Dynamoworks 'Nothing Compares' hand-set wood-type  print
description:
Our friend Chris at Dynamoworks has produced this A2-size (594mmx420mm) signed and editioned screenprint with a quote from John F Kennedy: "Nothing Compares to the Simple Pleasure of Riding a Bike". 

Made by setting vintage wood type to produce black and white proof prints on an Eagle Press, which are then scanned to edition as screenprints on off-white Stockwell Cartridge 200gsm paper. Editioned to 50, signed and numbered by the artist.

FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING

Find out more about Dynamoworks here:

www.dynamoworks.co.uk

And learn more about the story of these prints here: 

https://vimeo.com/63468489

name: Dynamoworks 'Construct the Future' print
description:
Our friend Chris at Dynamoworks has produced this A2-size (594mmx420mm) signed and editioned screenprint poster with a quote from the visionary architect Sir Bertram Clough Williams-Ellis: "Cherish the Past, Adorn the Present, Construct the Future". Made by setting vintage wood type to produce black and white proof prints on an Eagle Press (see second picture), which are then scanned to edition as screenprints on off-white Stockwell Cartridge 200gsm paper. Editioned to 50, signed and numbered by the artist.

FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING

Find out more about Dynamoworks here:

www.dynamoworks.co.uk

And learn more about the story of these prints here: 

https://vimeo.com/63468489

name: 'On the Line' print by Adams Carvalho
description:
Another fine-looking digital print by Boneshaker's long-time collaborator, Adams Carvalho. A3 size, on nice 250gsm textured Tinteretto Gesso paper stock, lovingly printed by Rik at Ripe Digital and hand-embossed with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

Sold unframed, but the print is a standard A3 size so fits easily into off-the-shelf shop bought frames.

Check out more of Adams' work at ffffixas.tumblr.com

name: 'Night Ride' print by Adams Carvalho
description:
Another fine-looking digital print by Boneshaker's long-time collaborator, Adams Carvalho. A3 size, on nice 250gsm textured Tinteretto Gesso paper stock, lovingly printed by Rik at Ripe Digital and hand-embossed with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

Sold unframed, but the print is a standard A3 size so fits easily into off-the-shelf shop bought frames.

Check out more of Adams' work at ffffixas.tumblr.com

name: The Indian Bicycle Shop 'The Real Steel' print Yellow/Blue
description:
Influenced by a matchbox they acquired on their travels in India,
these two-colour screen prints from the Indian Bicycle Shop were
designed by Kirk Watson, and pay homage to their manufacturer out in the Punjab; KW Industries. They are screen printed by hand by the good people at Tuck Shop London onto A3, 650gsm, recycled board. With only 20 prints of each colour, they are limited edition and individually numbered.

These prints are part of the Indian Bicycle Shop's BEYOND BICYCLES project. £10 from every individual print sold will help supply bicycles to motivated school girls in rural India who cannot afford the cost of public transport to get them to and from school - enabling them to complete their education.

The Indian Bicycle Shop are friends of Boneshaker - we met them at the 'Eat, Ride, Sleep, Repeat' event at the V&A in London, and were charmed by their beautiful old-style steel machines, and the fact that their production directly benefits the people of India. And the fact that they're really nice people. Find out more about them at www.indianbicycleshop.co.uk

The prints will be shipped to you unframed, directly from the Indian Bicycle Shop (who are based in the UK). Shipping is free.

name: The Indian Bicycle Shop 'The Real Steel' print Pink/Green
description:
Influenced by a matchbox they acquired on their travels in India,
these two-colour screen prints from the Indian Bicycle Shop were
designed by Kirk Watson, and pay homage to their manufacturer out in the Punjab; KW Industries. They are screen printed by hand by the good people at Tuck Shop London onto A3, 650gsm, recycled board. With only 20 prints of each colour, they are limited edition and individually numbered.

These prints are part of the Indian Bicycle Shop's BEYOND BICYCLES project. £10 from every individual print sold will help supply bicycles to motivated school girls in rural India who cannot afford the cost of public transport to get them to and from school - enabling them to complete their education.

The Indian Bicycle Shop are friends of Boneshaker - we met them at the 'Eat, Ride, Sleep, Repeat' event at the V&A in London, and were charmed by their beautiful old-style steel machines, and the fact that their production directly benefits the people of India. And the fact that they're really nice people. Find out more about them at www.indianbicycleshop.co.uk

The prints will be shipped to you unframed, directly from the Indian Bicycle Shop (who are based in the UK). Shipping is free.

name: Indian Bicycle Shop 'The Real Steel' print Blue/Red
description:
Influenced by a matchbox they acquired on their travels in India,
these two-colour screen prints from the Indian Bicycle Shop were
designed by Kirk Watson, and pay homage to their manufacturer out in the Punjab; KW Industries. They are screen printed by hand by the good people at Tuck Shop London onto A3, 650gsm, recycled board. With only 20 prints of each colour, they are limited edition and individually numbered.

These prints are part of the Indian Bicycle Shop's BEYOND BICYCLES project. £10 from every individual print sold will help supply bicycles to motivated school girls in rural India who cannot afford the cost of public transport to get them to and from school - enabling them to complete their education.

The Indian Bicycle Shop are friends of Boneshaker - we met them at the 'Eat, Ride, Sleep, Repeat' event at the V&A in London, and were charmed by their beautiful old-style steel machines, and the fact that their production directly benefits the people of India. And the fact that they're really nice people. Find out more about them at www.indianbicycleshop.co.uk

The prints will be shipped to you unframed, directly from the Indian Bicycle Shop (who are based in the UK). Shipping is free.

name: 'Superheroes' print by Evgenia Barinova
description:
We've been honoured to include the work of illustrator Evgenia Barinova many times in Boneshaker and this design is definitely one of our favourites, so we've reproduced it in a big A3 print, digitally printed by Rik at Ripe Digital onto lovely textured 250gsm Tinteretto Gesso paper.

Prints sold unframed, shipped in a postal tube. Being standard A3 size, they fit easily into ready made frames.

Check out more of Evgenia's work here:
eveningworkroom.com

name: Boneshaker Magazine Issue 11 (PDF Download version)
description: Boneshaker issue 11 includes bicycle walls of death, hump-backed scorchers from the 19th Century, bikes and bad politics, a photo essay on an unseen side of Keirin racing, tall-bikes as a tool for challenging conformity and a song-singing cycle ride to India, amongst other things… By purchasing this digital format of the magazine, you are helping us to sustain the printed version, rather than replacing it. The artwork within the magazine is the copyright of the artists involved - with this PDF version you can click through to their websites and find out more about these great creative people. PLEASE NOTE: Once you have purchased this from us, you will be sent a link from Pulley to the PDF file. This file is approx. 11mb, so please be patient while downloading. The download is limited to three attempts, if you have problems downloading, please contact us via www.boneshakermag.com

name: Boneshaker Magazine Issue 10 (PDF Download version)
description: Cycling and theatre don’t often get mentioned in the same sentence - but there’s a shared grace, balance and physical dedication inherent in both. Our piece 'Breakaway Stages' takes in Don Quixote by Bike, Godiva Awakes from the cutural olympiad and other theatre groups using bicycles to explore the world around them as their stage. David Serrano's photo story of turns the camera on the spectators of a touring stage and shows the theatre thats behind these big events.We hear from bee-keeping bikers, catch up with two very different bike projects in Toulon and New York and feature an amusing ode to something very familiar to everyday cyclist - the 'potbelly'. Also, Boneshaker’s reached issue 10 - we’ve come a long way since the wide-eyed first forays of issue 1. We’ve certainly got a long way to go yet. To have reached our tenth issue with all our positivity and pure-heartedness intact really does feel like a significant point; and a bit like a birthday. So slip a couple of beers into your pannier alongside issue 10, roll out to your favourite spot and join us in celebratin By purchasing this digital format of the magazine, you are helping us to sustain the printed version, rather than replacing it. The artwork within the magazine is the copyright of the artists involved - with this PDF version you can click through to their websites and find out more about these great creative people. PLEASE NOTE: Once you have purchased this from us, you will be sent a link from Pulley to the PDF file. This file is approx. 9mb, so please be patient while downloading.

name: Boneshaker Issue 9
description: Girls on bikes, reclaiming the streets of Bogota, bike smut, art meets bikes, why bikes might be bisexual, men digging, and one very unlucky chicken. Yup, it's the brand new issue of Boneshaker, packed as ever with unusual bike-related stories and pictures. Foreword by Rob Penn, author of 'It's All About The Bike'. Cover art by Evgenia Barinova.

name: 'Fifty years on, still riding' Boneshaker Artcrank 2012 print
description:
For the second year running, Boneshaker's got involved with Artcrank, 'the poster party for  bike people'. It's basically an excuse to make loads of great bike art. Here's this year's distinguished creation, 'Fifty years on, still riding', designed by Boneshaker's creative director John Coe and screenprinted by hand  by the good folks at White Duck on 270gsm acid-free archival stock. 

As with all our products, if Big Cartel overcharges you for postage (for example when ordering several different items) we'll refund you the overcharge. 

artcrank.com
www.coecreative.com
www.whiteduckscreenprint.co.uk

name: Major Taylor print by Eliza Southwood (red)
description:
To celebrate her beautiful feature in issue 10, we've teamed up with illustrator Eliza Southwood to create these rather appealing prints. The racer pictured is the pioneering Marshall 'Major' Taylor, who overcame extreme racial discrimination to win several world records and titles (including World Track Cycling Champion, 1899).

Digitally printed in Bristol by the ever-amenable Rik at Ripe Digital on A3 size, slightly textured tinteretto gesso paper. Each print has been hand-embossed by moonlight with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

Sold unframed (but being A3 it will fit easily into an appropriate shop-bought frame). 

http://www.elizasouthwood.com/

name: 'Wolfman' print by Stevie Gee
description:
As featured on the cover of Boneshaker Issue 8, here's Stevie Gee's 'Wolfman' design - perhaps inspired by Kraftwerk's Tour de France, and Teen Wolf - digitally printed in Bristol by the ever-amenable Rik at Ripe Digital on A3 size, 250gsm, textured Tinteretto Gesso paper. Each print has been hand-embossed by moonlight with the Boneshaker embosser (see second picture). 

A3 size, sold unframed.

Check out more of Stevie's fine work at http://steviegee.tumblr.com/

name: Boneshaker 'Crossed Cranks' Classic Tee - White
description: An organic cotton, Earth Positive* tee, hand screen printed by the good folks at Uno One screenprint in Bristol. White tee, printed in a tasty petrol blue colour with Crossed Cranks design on the front and a discrete Boneshaker logo on the nape of the neck at the back. *Earth Positive means the shirts are produced under the Global Organic Textile standard from Indian Cotton, certified by the Soil Association, and manufactured using solely renewable green energy from wind and solar power. The Crossed Cranks logo was designed by the wonderful Ben Steers. Seek him out at bensteers.com --------------------------------------- www.boneshakermag.com unooneprint.com

name: Boneshaker 'Crossed Cranks' Classic Tee - Black
description: An organic cotton, Earth Positive* t-shirt for the cyclist in your life, hand screen printed by the good folks at Uno One screenprint in Bristol. Plain black tee, printed in white with Crossed Cranks design on the front and a discrete Boneshaker logo on the nape of the neck at the back. *Earth Positive means the shirts are produced under the Global Organic Textile standard from Indian Cotton, certified by the Soil Association, and manufactured using solely renewable green energy from wind and solar power. The Crossed Cranks logo was designed by the wonderful Ben Steers. Seek him out at bensteers.com --------------------------------------- www.boneshakermag.com unooneprint.com

name: Our Chains Set Us Free T-shirt, white
description:
We're proud as anything to have been involved with the Bristol Cycle Festival this year (and last), so when the opportunity arose to help them out by getting some of their beautiful t-shirts printed up we jumped at the chance. And here they are - available for cycle lovers everywhere. Limited stock - get 'em while you can.

'Our Chains Set Us Free' design on the front, small Bristol Cycle Festival logo on nape.

Boneshaker's taking a tiny cut of the sale price of these, the rest goes towards Bristol Cycle Festival.

Designed in Bristol by the good folks at Play Nicely
www.playnicely.co.uk

name: 'Roll for the Soul' Tee by Rob Draper
description: Illustrated by Rob Draper, and hand screen printed in the U.K. by our good friends at White Duck. Based on the same artwork as the the A2 screenprint, this 100% cotton tee has a nostalgic feel to it. ---------------------------------------------- www.robdraper.co.uk www.boneshakermag.com www.whiteduckscreenprint.co.uk

name: 'Roll for the Soul' by Rob Draper
description: Available here is an A2, 1 colour screen printed poster featuring a beautiful Rob Draper illustration made exclusively for Boneshaker magazine, in collaboration between White Duck. Produced as a limited 1st edition of just 100, onto a 270gsm acid-free and archival stock, each print are signed and numbered by the artist and dual-embossed with the Boneshaker and White Duck insignias. Exquisitely realised and beautifully crafted, this was the first print produced with White Duck and marked the start of our ongoing collaboration with them. ----------------------------------------------------- www.robdraper.co.uk www.boneshakermag.com www.whiteduckscreenprint.co.uk

name: 'Bike Sweet Bike' print by Kerry Hyndman
description:
After doing the beautiful 'Short Lapses of Silence' illustration for issue 8 (which we featured on an artist postcard, too) we were keen to work with illustrator Kerry Hyndman again. Here's the result: 'Bike Sweet Bike' an A4 size Giclee print that looks a bit like those old-fashioned Home Sweet Home sewing samplers. 

Limited edition of 30, printed on Hahnemühle Photo Rag Ultra Smooth 100% cotton paper, signed and numbered by the artist. 
Sold unframed. 

www.kerryhyndman.co.uk

Printed at Ripe Digital
www.ripedigital.co.uk

name: Dennis Gould 'Homage' print on handmade flower paper
description: Dennis is a poet/artist/cyclist who creates prints of his poetry. He was kind enough to create a limited edition print of his brilliant 'Homage' piece, created in celebration of the launch of Issue 7 of Boneshaker Magazine (in which he featured). Limited edition print created using the woodblock letterpress technique. Printed in one colour on heavy handmade paper stock, with flowers and blades of grass pressed into the paper during its construction (see second picture). The prints are approximately A4 size - though individual dimensions may vary slightly as they're hand-cut. Some are a bit wonky - each one is unique. This is part of the charm of Dennis' work. Read more about Dennis, visit our website, or order a copy of issue 7.

name: Boneshaker issue 6
description:
We've a just discovered we still have one box left of issue 6! Get 'em while you can...

 Articles include the first in a series on the dark art of bicycle maintenance; 'Trial and Error' - an insight into early memories of learning to ride a bike; and some unexpected bicycle bling from Sudan. The contributions come from further and further afield and articles such as 'Cycling + Religion' and 'My Balls' keep the articles a little different from the norm.... in true Boneshaker style.

The publication has 60 pages, is perfect bound, advert free, printed on FSC approved uncoated Challenger Offset.

Don't miss out in future - you can subscribe here:

name: Green Oil Chain Lube 100ml - FREE UK Postage!
description:
Planet-friendly chain lube made from plant based and sustainably sourced ingredients rather than petrochemicals.

It's an all-conditions lube that prevents rust and reduces wear, offering award-winning performance to make your beloved bike run smoother for longer. Oh yeah.

Posted free to anywhere in the UK.

name: Boneshaker issue 4
description:
Issue 4 includes the story of Dom Gill’s remarkable tandem adventures (picking up strangers all the way down the Americas), the regular My Beautiful Bike  - this time with words by John McFaul, and illustration by Nicola Meiring, a profile of the real life brothers behind Brother Cycles, some bicycle storytelling and even a bit of bike poetry.

Each issue is 60 pages, perfect bound, advert free, printed on FSC approved uncoated Challenger Offset. They even smell good

name: Boneshaker issue 3
description:
Articles include ‘My Beautiful Bike’ by Minotaur Shock, an 8-page profile on the artisans of Portland, Oregon and more Slowcoast antics from Nick Hand. From bike workshops in Columbia, to tandem cycling for the visually impaired, we bring you the most interesting and inspiring articles to get you out on your bicycle, or even making something unique with its parts.

The publication has 60 pages, is perfect bound, advert free, printed on FSC approved uncoated Challenger Offset.

name: 'Conversations on the Coast' by Nick Hand
description:
Nick Hand set off on his bicycle from Bristol in the summer of 2009 to cycle over 6000 miles around the coast of the British Isles. The people he talked to along the way included weavers, boat builders, a stickmaker, bicycle mechanic, screen printer, cheese maker and tea taster. Conversations were recorded and edited as photofilms and uploaded from the saddle to the Slowcoast website, giving followers of the journey the chance to meet an inspirational group of people living and working around the coast of England, Scotland, Wales and Ireland.

Nick Hand is a long-time friend of Boneshaker, who's contributed excerpts from his Slow Coast project to several of our issues. He's just made this beautiful book, and we're delighted to have a few copies to pass on to good people like you.

'Conversations on the Coast' presents a selection of 20 stories and photography from the Slowcoast project.

"What I love most about this book is the humility of actually quite ordinary artisans chosen by chance as they came into focus on one man's remarkable journey around the coast. What we learn is that when you take the time to look, even the apparently straight forward lives of a bicycle repairer, hat maker or basket weaver are driven by passion and a deep seated love for their work. It is inspirational."

Robin Wood, Chair of The Heritage Crafts Association

See more images at http://departmentofsmallworks.co.uk/images/series-5-conversations.aspx
Included in the book:

Kay Anderson, Spinner

Bill Bontoft, Stickmaker

Austin Brown, Bicycle Mechanic

Will Brown, Outfitter

Merin Crossingham, Animator

Sheena Devitt, Stone Letter Carver

Martin Doyle, Flute Maker

Laurence Edwards, Sculptor

Douglas Grierson, Weaver

John Joseph Hanna, Hat Maker

Joanne B Kaar, Paper Maker

Paul F Kelly, Gold and Silversmith

Nigel Legee, Fisherman and Artist

Dominique Lieb, Letterpress Printer

Joanne Mitchell, Glass Maker

Kiera Rathbone, Typewriter Artist

John J Savage, Storyteller

Peter Segger, Organic Farmer

Pat Tanner, Boat Builder

Pip Weaser, Basket Maker

name: Our first Artists' Postcard set (plus FREE badges & stickers)
description:
Set of 6 postcards, A6 size, created for the launch of issue 6 of Boneshaker. Each card in the set includes an illustration from one of the first six issues, artists include Adams Carvalho, Rob Hunter, Blanca Gomez, Evgenia Barinova, Joe Waldron and Imogen Shaw.

The postcards sets come with 5 free badges (to share with your friends or keep for yourself - you choose) and a couple of vinyl stickers (these are weather-proof, so you can stick them on your bike or around town). NB - the badge designs that come with this pack are the new version (metallic red, silver and black designs, as seen in the photos of 'Our Second Artists' Postcard set') - we've now run out of the old badge designs. The new ones are super nice though!

name: Our second Artists' Postcard Set (plus FREE badges & stickers)
description:
Set of 6 postcards, A6 size. Each card in the set includes an illustration from one of the following artists: Stevie Gee, John Coe, Abi Stevens, Kerry Hyndman, Joe Waldron and Rosie Gainsborough.

The postcards sets come with 5 free chrome badges (to share with your friends or keep for yourself - you choose) and a couple of vinyl stickers (these are weather-proof, so you can stick them on your bike or around town).

name: Boneshaker Magazine (PDF) - Issue 9
description: Girls on bikes, reclaiming the streets of Bogota, bike smut, art meets bikes, why bikes might be bisexual, men digging, and one very unlucky chicken. Yup, it's the brand new issue of Boneshaker, packed as ever with unusual bike-related stories and pictures. Foreword by Rob Penn, author of 'It's All About The Bike'. Cover art by Evgenia Barinova. By purchasing this digital format of the magazine, you are helping us to sustain the printed version, rather than replacing it. The artwork within the magazine is the copyright of the artists involved - with this PDF version you can click through to their websites and find out more about these great creative people. PLEASE NOTE: Once you have purchased this from us, you will be sent a link from Pulley to the PDF file. This file is approx. 21mb, so please be patient while downloading.

description: Articles include an expansive piece on Bike Polo: we hear about the history of the sport, insights by an tournament organiser, a rider, a newcomer to the sport and also some tips on mallet-making. name: Boneshaker Issue 10
description:
In which we ponder cycling and Cubism, the cyclist's potbelly, beekeeping by bicycle, night rides, endless straight roads, bicycles in theatre, mile counting, Major Taylor and death, amongst many other things. 

Skeletons on the cover for Halloween. And because we like skeletons.

The publication has 60 pages, is perfect bound, advert free, printed on FSC approved uncoated Challenger Offset.

name: Boneshaker Magazine Issue 8
description:
Ever eaten a bear? Raced your bike through a strange Austrian's apartment? This issue tries both. With its outstanding cover by Illustrator Stevie Gee, with more than a little nod to Kraftwerk's 'Tour de France' artwork (albeit in Stevie's unique style), this issue hits hard from the get-go.

With the usual heady mix of bike poetry, chain art from Korea and a vivid account of one man's memories of a crash, there is a something unusual at the turn of every page. The contributors have outdone themselves with the quality of their writing, photography and illustration and Boneshaker are proud as punch to share them with you in the pages of issue 8.

The publication has 60 pages, is perfect bound, advert free, printed on FSC approved uncoated Challenger Offset.

name: 'Homage' by Dennis Gould (225mm x 320mm)
description: Dennis is a poet/artist/cyclist who creates prints of his poetry. He was kind enough to create a limited edition print of his brilliant 'Homage' piece, created in celebration of the launch of Issue 7 of Boneshaker Magazine (in which he featured). Limited edition print created using the woodblock letterpress technique. Printed in one colour on heavy cream stock, in a limited edition of 50. The smaller prints are 225mm wide x 320mm high. Each print is signed and numbered by the artist. To read more about Dennis, visit our website, or order a copy of the magazine.
